head.title: Storms Blow Out Power, Heat and Flight Schedules

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Storms Blow Out Power, Heat and Flight Schedules

abstract.p: New York Metropolitan area's five-day hot spell ends as thunderstorms, high winds and hailstones sweep through area (S)

block.p: The New York area's five-day hot spell ended with a bang yesterday, as thunderstorms, high winds and hailstones as big around as nickels swept through. The storms forced the cancellation or delay of hundreds of commercial flights and knocked out electricity to nearly 20,000 people.
The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said flights in and out of Newark, La Guardia and Kennedy airports, which it operates, were delayed for an average of three hours.
